content:
You're welcome!

It sounds like you have a clear plan to organize your papers in Mendeley. By creating a thesis folder with subfolders for each chapter, you'll be able to keep your papers structured and easily accessible. Using tags to categorize papers by theme and methodology will also help you quickly identify papers that are relevant to specific aspects of your research.

Prioritizing papers using the star rating system and creating a "must-read" list will ensure that you're focusing on the most critical papers and not getting overwhelmed by the sheer volume of literature. And by taking notes on each paper, you'll be able to engage with the content more deeply and identify connections between papers that might not be immediately apparent.

Remember to regularly review and refine your paper organization system as your research evolves. You may find that you need to create new folders or tags, or that certain papers become more or less relevant over time.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Otherwise, I wish you all the best with your thesis, and I hope Mendeley helps you stay organized and focused throughout your research journey!
